metadata.creator: Jason Morningstar
metadata.boilerplate: This playset is an accessory for the Fiasco role-playing game by Bully Pulpit Games.  This playset is copyright 2010 by Jason Morningstar. Fiasco is copyright 2009 by Jason Morningstar. All rights are reserved.  For more information about Fiasco or to download other playsets and materials, visit www.bullypulpitgames.com.  If you'd like to create your own playset or other Fiasco-related content, we'd like to help. Write us at info@bullypulpitgames.com.
metadata.score: Adding some pitch black and blood red to the great white north ... fishing villages and fishing village idiots, timber contracts and factory ships, State Troopers in floatplanes and the weird guys who hide when they fly over - set among the emerald forests of southeast Alaska's vast archipelago, this playset drags an offbeat but familiar setting into the crosshairs.

To get even: with a state or federal agency
with this village for what it has turned you into
with this village, and all the nosy small people in it
To get the truth: about the thing you saw in Kaku Inlet
To get respect: from this town, by bringing down the fishing monopoly
from this town, by teaching them to be afraid
from your lover, by proving your devotion
from the police, by turning in your own kin to the state troopers
from a family member, by doing what they never could
from yourself, by solving the problem permanently
To get laid: by that special someone who doesn't even know you exist
in the middle of the Russian Orthodox church
by an old lover, to see if sparks fly again
in a drunken stupor, by whoever you end up with
by someone who can really grease the wheels for your project
to prove you've still got it
To get out: of this town, because you have big dreams
of this town, to escape family and tradition
of an obligation to a dangerous outsider
of an obligation to your family
To get rich: through the death of a native elder
through ripping off the village emergency fund
through stealing a pile of fishing boat IFQ money

Crime: Fishing outlaws (quota thieves, endangered species bycatch sellers)
Around the Village: Church folk (deacon, Sunday school teacher, secretary)
Representative/citizen (Case worker, parole officer, native corporation official)
Athletes (recreation league, coach, pick-up games, minor league)
Work: Professional and client (doctor, lawyer, dealer, wilderness guide)

Ugly: Candid videotape of a former Governor
Valuables: Mason jar filled with pre-revolution Russian gold coins
Purebred Weimeraner with an ear tattoo
Sentimental: Old letters from a dead man
Family heirloom no longer in family possession

First Street: Southeast Federal Credit Union, the only bank in town
Tongass Avenue: The Municipal building, police station, courthouse and city hall
Pacific Medical Clinic, the only doctor in town
Sun Chasers tanning salon and weight loss center
The Harbor: Aboard the purse seiner MV Julie Autumn
Neptune Aviation Services and state floatplane dock
Holiday Lines cruise ship terminal and office
Residences: The trailer at the end of Tongass Avenue
The Backcountry: The four-wheeler track out to Kaku Inlet
Kaku Inlet: University of Alaska Southeast fisheries research station
The Skinny Dick dam and reservoir
